column4: hi all, i am installing an NIS client using Ubuntu, and this problem happen: YPBINDPROC_DOMAIN: Domain not bound
ok - your not bound to the domain - have you set the domain name ?
where i set ? i set the domain in yp.conf
do "domainname" see if its set
thats not what I said do
I said show me the output of domainname
ok - thats better
the server is in the same network. but someone told me that is necessary to register the client in the server. is it true ?
yes totally
how to register in the server ?
I'm a bit rusty but it is a command called "nis_client_setup" or smething like that
I'll see if I can dig it out
now i run rpcinfo -u labix ypserv
i try to run yptest
NICE find
an question, wih the rpcinfo, is the client registered in the server, or not yet ?
rpcinfo means the server responded to it, doesn't mean its registered as I remember
well, the answer was good :)
I'm rusty on legacy nis, so don't take what I say as fact
ok, but you are helping me a lot !!!!
if you can wait a few hours (big ask I know) I can sort you out properly when I get home to a nis box
